posts.name: Alexis
posts.cooked: Does anyone have any good pre-made CAD exercises for teaching new students? Iâ€™ve seen threads of CAD practice drawings but I canâ€™t seem to locate them. Does anyone know where these threads are, or have any resources for something similar? For reference, my team uses Fusion 360.

posts.name: Sanchit Arora
posts.cooked: If youâ€™re looking into practice drawings, last yearâ€™s CADvent is a really great starting point.

posts.name: Alexis
posts.cooked: YES thats exactly what i was thinking of. i forgot what the name of it was but i remember seeing that when it came out last year. tysm!

posts.name: Pizzatc
posts.cooked:
Are you trying to teach them just the very basics of CAD like the tool bar and how to use shapes, patterns, constraints, etc

Or are you trying to teach them how to design FRC subsystems?

posts.name: Alexis
posts.cooked: this is my other account, found the login a few minutes ago basically trying to teach how to use the tool while also teaching the very basics of design

posts.name: Pizzatc
posts.cooked:
So my recommendation is this. If you have any old part drawings of like 2x1â€™s and hex shafts I would give those to the members you are trying to train and have them recreate them in CAD and kind of just let them figure out the tool bar by experimentation(that way lets them learn the other tools too) and just gently point them in the right direction.

If they have some knowledge of the tool bar but want some basics of FRC design

This video here is by far my favorite video to give to people who are trying to learn how to design for FRC

posts.name: Sam Geckler
posts.cooked: We do several things. For brand new learners, I ask them to work through this 16 part series. As they complete them if they have questions or couldnâ€™t make the parts as shown in the videos, I work with them to find the problems. They are a bit dated now as the Fusion interface has changed some, but I think they are useful for learning the basics.

posts.name: Drew Williams
posts.cooked: The Robochargers (3005) put together an excellent series on CAD, Design and Onshape. Check it out on their youtube. (Some of the videos will be in the Live tab as well)
